div.l: He can wel in myn ye seen a stalk
But in his owne ye he cannot seen̄ a balk
Here endith the Prolog of the Reue
And here beginneth his tale folwing

l.hi: t trompington not fer fro cambrigge
l.note: Entire first line in display script.

div.l: Ther goth a brook and ouer that a brigge
Vpon̄ the which brook therto stont a melle
And this is the verry soth as I you telle
A Meller was ther dwellyng many a day
As any Pecok he was proude and gay
Pipen he couthe fisshe and nettes bete
And torne cuppes and wel wratle and shete
Ay be his belt he bar a long panade
And of a swerd ful trenchant was the blade
A ioly popper bar he in his pouche
Ther was noman̄ for ꝑperill dorst him touche
A sheffeld twytel bar he in his hose
Round was his face and cāmmuse was his nose
And piled as an Ape was his sculle
He was a market beter at the fulle
Ther dorst no wiȝt hand vpon him legge
That he ne swore he shuld anon̄ abegge
A theef was he forsothe of corn̄ and mele
And that a sly and vsant for to stele
His name was hoten deynous symkyn
A wif he had comen of noble kyn
The person of the toun her fadir was
With her he yaf full many a panne of bras
For that symkyn shuld in his blode allye
She was I fostred in a Nonnerye
For Symkyn wold no wif as he seide
But she were wel I norisshed and a mayde
